text.text: Can you provide step-by-step instructions for manually advancing claims to the next payer after Medicaid payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: To manually advance a claim to the next payer after Medicaid payment, you can go to the claim page and manually advance to the next payer. Here are the steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search bar and then click the claim number in the search results. This will take you to the Claim page for that claim. 2. Click the COB tab. 3. Select the payer type and then click the radio button under the Primary payer box. 4. Click Save changes.

text.text: What options are available for advancing claims to secondary or tertiary payers after Medicaid payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: When a Medicaid payer is followed by a government or facility payer in the COB, the system no longer displays the review screen after a Medicaid payment is posted. In this case, the system does not automatically advance the claim from Medicaid to the next payer. To advance, the user can go to the claim page and manually advance to the next payer.

text.text: Are there any specific considerations or implications when using Government and Facility policy types in ZOLL Billing?

text: Policies with the Government and Facility policy types, can be used as a secondary after a Medicaid primary. Government policy types can be used as a secondary and tertiary. Any policy type can be selected as secondary or tertiary to a "Government" payer.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle the coordination of benefits process when a Medicaid payer is followed by a government or facility payer?

text: When a Medicaid payer is followed by a government or facility payer in the COB, the system no longer displays the review screen after a Medicaid payment is posted. In this case, the system does not automatically advance the claim from Medicaid to the next payer.

text.text: Can any policy type be selected as secondary or tertiary to a Government payer in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, any policy type can be selected as secondary or tertiary to a "Government" payer.

text.text: Is there a specific process for advancing claims from Medicaid to government or facility payers in ZOLL Billing?

text: To advance, the user can go to the claim page and manually advance to the next payer.

text.text: What happens when a Medicaid payer is followed by a government or facility payer in ZOLL Billing's coordination of benefits process?

text: When a Medicaid payer is followed by a government or facility payer in the COB, the system no longer displays the review screen after a Medicaid payment is posted. In this case, the system does not automatically advance the claim from Medicaid to the next payer. To advance, the user can go to the claim page and manually advance to the next payer.

text.text: How do Government policy types function in ZOLL Billing when used as secondary or tertiary payers?

text: Policies with the Government and Facility policy types can be used as a secondary after a Medicaid primary. Government policy types can be used as a secondary and tertiary.

text.text: Can you explain the Government and Facility policy types in ZOLL Billing?

text: Any policy type can be selected as secondary or tertiary to a "Government" payer.

text.text: What are the different types of payer policy types available in ZOLL Billing?

text: There are a number of types to choose from, including: Insurance/Government, Government, Facility, PPO, POS, EPO, Indemnity Insurance, HMO, Medicare Risk, AM-Automobile Medical, BL-Blue Cross/Blue Shield.
